LanguageData.PlantPotato.label: Potato Plant
LanguageData.PlantPotato.description: Potato Plants produce nutritious tubers called Potatoes. Potato Plants grow quickly and are a reliable food source crop for basic meals。
LanguageData.PlantCorn.label: Corn Plant
LanguageData.PlantCorn.description: Corn Plants are large grain plants that produce ears of delicious yellow seeds that are called Corn. Corn Plants grow slowly but yeild lots of food. Corn is useful as a food ingredient or for making Ethanol Fuel。
LanguageData.PlantRice.label: Rice Plant
LanguageData.PlantRice.description: Rice Plants are short grain plants that yields numerous amounts of edible seeds called Rice. Rice is useful as a meal ingredient, can be made into Ethanol Fuel or distilled into Sake from the Brewery。
LanguageData.Planteggplant.label: 茄子
LanguageData.Planteggplant.description: Eggplant Bushes produce large, purple, egg-shaped fruits called Eggplant Fruit. Eggplant Bushes grow quickly, as the plant is related to the fast growing Potato Plant。
LanguageData.Plantbean.label: 豆子
LanguageData.Plantbean.description: A Bean Stalk produces a Bean Pod, a soft shell with small, edible seeds inside. They can be used as a meal ingredient or can be refined into BioDiesel Fuel。
LanguageData.PlantTomato.label: 西红柿
LanguageData.PlantTomato.description: Tomato Vines produce round, palm sized, red, sharp-tasting fruits called Tomatoes. Tomatoes are related to Potato Plants and grow very quickly。
LanguageData.PlantCarrot.label: 胡萝卜
LanguageData.PlantCarrot.description: Carrot Plants produce long, crunchy, orange root vegetables called Carrots. Carrots are refreshing to eat raw and have a long shelf life。
LanguageData.PlantCabbage.label: 卷心菜
LanguageData.PlantCabbage.description: Cabbage Plants produce large, edible leaves called Cabbage. Cabbage is an essential component in many salads。
LanguageData.Plantmushroom.label: 香菇
LanguageData.Plantmushroom.description: Champignon Mushrooms produce white or brown edible caps called Raw Champignon. This robust mushroom has been genetically engineered and is cultivated to produce a filling meat substitute。
